page.title: 02Light Hall Farm, Solihull.
page.content: The 240 acres of{Light Hall Farm}are owned and worked by Mr. and Mrs. C.D.Smalley and son. Only on Fridays do they employ an extra hand. The farmhouse, barn, "herringbone" milking parlour and winter cow shed are situated close to{Dog Kennel Lane, {Shirley.}The land is divided into 17 fields. The inner six, in which can be found three ponds and a stream, are used for grazing the 96 Fresian cows, 66 calves, a bull and several horses. Thus the cows do not have far to travel or roads to cross each milking time. The remaining fields are used for growing wheat or barley on a rotational system and 4 are reserved for growing animal fodder. To improve efficiency machinery used includes 4 tractors, a combine harvester, grass cutter, hay turner, fertilizer spreader, cultivator and others.
